intro: Rubus vestitus var. eglandulosus, commonly known as the glandular bramble, is a shrub native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits known as drupes, which are typically red or black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
